posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.56.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • Sometimes a powerful story can really move you, so we fixed a bug that made it difficult to move the Signal window while viewing content in the Stories tab.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.55.0-beta.1…v7.56.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

New Version: 7.56.0-beta.1

58 new commits since 7.55.0-beta.2:

Show commits

  • v7.56.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Bump electron from 35.1.4 to 36.0.1 [2]

  • Better update handling on Linux [3]

  • Receive side of remote mute [4]

  • Fix backup validation errors [5]

  • Upgrade libsignal to v0.71.0 [6]

  • Optimize publicKey deserialization for server trust root [7]

  • Fix conversation view from getting stale data [8]

  • Fix sass deprecation warnings and make them fatal [9]

  • Introduce infrastructure for Notification Profiles [10]

  • Wrap all React roots with StrictMode [11]

  • Throttle unread updates [12]

  • Add workaround to fix Linux GTK version for electron [13]

  • Fix mismatching gif response byte length [14]

  • Better context menu on macOS [15]

  • Display emoji completions with diacritics [16]

  • Fix camera state after screen sharing [17]

  • Notification Profiles: Ensure recently-created profiles always take precedence [18]

  • Ignore 500s/identity key errors for GSE toast [19]

  • Attribute exported group updates to local ACI [20]

  • makeHttpError: Ensure response headers have lowercase names [21]

  • Add backdrop blur to image grid download button [22]

  • Update sqlcipher to 2.0.3 [23]

  • Basic support for local encrypted backups [24]

  • Add content protection checkbox to Settings window [25]

  • Add keyboard shortcuts to fun picker [26]

  • Improve reaction targeting [27]

  • Bump electron from 36.0.1 to 36.2.0 [28]

  • Scope down content protection to Windows 11 [29]

  • Fix runtime error in nickname equality check [30]

  • Don't drop about-to-disappear messages [31]

  • Fix state after backup integration tests [32]

  • Run SQL corruption check on logic error [33]

  • Prefix sql read/write errors with method name [34]

  • Use frame-by-frame validator for testing [35]

  • Send and properly receive AttachmentPointer.uploadTimestamp [36]

  • Update release notes [37]

  • Update strings [38]

  • Update DNS fallback [39]

  • Scope down content protection further for now [40]

  • Fix local backup for attachments needing reencryption [41]

  • Handle locally missing attachments for local backups [42]

  • Fix gif download error with mismatching slice byte length [43]

  • Bump libsignal-client to v0.71.1 [44]

  • Adjust story buttons to not overlap window drag region [45]

  • Fallback to global media tier CDN number [46]

  • Improve logging when falling back to transit tier for attachment downloads [47]

  • Upgrade electron to 36.2.1 [48]

  • Bump libsignal-client to 0.72.1 [49]

  • Fix backup export error for pending direct calls [50]

  • Improve pasted image filenames [51]

  • Refactor idle download state [52]

  • Reorder getSendTarget logic for clarity [53]

  • Require PQ pre-keys from the server [54]

  • Fix additional backup export validation errors [55]

  • Release notes for 7.56 [56]

  • Update strings [57]

  • 7.56.0-beta.1 [58]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.55.0-beta.2…v7.56.0-beta.1

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

  • Update strings [3]

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
The German translation for “your message edit maximum is reached” is grammatically incorrect.

Current: Diese Nachricht kann nur 10 Male bearbeitet werden.
Corrected: Diese Nachricht kann nur 10 Mal bearbeitet werden.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.57 release

posts.cooked:
Hi @paulschoen, thanks for pointing that out.
While both variants are correct (see Mal ▶ Rechtschreibung, Bedeutung, Definition, Herkunft | Duden) I changed it nevertheless, as your suggested variant seems more common and “modern”.
Thanks for your feedback!
